subject: Science
title: Bioluminescence: Living Light
description: A fast breakdown of Bioluminescence: Living Light for builders.

hook.text: In the deep ocean, most creatures make their own light. It's the rule, not the exception.

buildup.text: Bioluminescence is a chemical reaction: a molecule called luciferin reacts with oxygen.

discovery.text: Some use it to lure prey. Others use it to startle predators or attract mates.

twist.text: The anglerfish dangles a glowing lure in pitch darkness. Curious prey swim straight in.

climax.text: Up to 90% of deep-sea creatures are bioluminescent. Darkness breeds innovation.

punchline.text: In the deep ocean, if you can't make light, you can't eat, mate, or survive.

quiz.question: What percentage of deep-sea creatures are bioluminescent?
